name: InterContinental Porto Palacio das Cardosas

reviews.text: I am not surprised to see that this is the number 1 Hotel in Porto. It fulfils the service of its star rating whilst offering the feel of a city landmark.
reviews.title: Beautiful and perfect service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its fairly well priced and location is fantastic.
reviews.title: Luxurious accomodation in ideal location all for a good price!!

reviews.text: As the taxi pulled up to our hotel the night we arrived, I was immediately impressed. The ornate architecture of the exterior of the building and the posh lobby interior were a welcoming site after a long flight. The staff was friendly but especially the waitress in the bar. The bar had a library type decor which was sophisticated and perfect for sipping port. The evening we arrived it was late but we were hungry as we hadn't had dinner that during the traveling that evening. We kindly asked the waitress if could at least have a small cheese plate as the kitchen had already closed. She obliged with a nice selection of cheeses and some bread. We munched on this along with some recommended Port. It was a perfect way to end our first evening in Porto. The rooms are relatively spacious, beds quite comfortable, and modern clean bathrooms. A nice extensive breakfast is offerred in their restaurant, which has a good view on one of the main squares......a relaxing place to start of planning your day! We received a great rate for our room...which made it all the more worth it!. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again when in Porto!
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Intercontinental Porto for business, what an incredible experience, excellent service, really super friendly and attentive staff, super comfortable bed and room. I had manicure in the Spa, quite recommended. The snacks in the bar very tasty. I will definitively will stay in this hotel next time I will go back to Porto.Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Nostalgia

reviews.text: Hi there, just back from a really beautiful long weekend in Oporto, staying in Palacio das Cardosas, where the staff are unbelievably friendly and helpful. Our concierge gave us advice as to restaurants to visit, places to avoid and seemed always to be available to make our stay enjoyable.My last visit to Oporto was as a wine student in the summer of 1967,so not only has the city changed so much for the better,but as pensioners my wife and I are so much more able to appreciate the beautiful buildings and Fado music in the numerous bars surrounding the hotel.. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the square, and was surprisingly quiet.We dined in the hotel on one evening,and our seafood was incredible...Full marks. Breakfast was quite good,after which we were able to catch the Hop on Hop off bus just outside the door. Our bed was one of the most comfortable ever, and the view over the square in the morning from the balcony windows was stunning. We hope to return in September, and would certainly use the Palacio.
reviews.title: A decent 4 stars, but certainly not five !
Great location! Great staff!
reviews.text: We stayed at the InterContinental in Porto in March. Lovely rooms with very comfortable beds and pillows.The front desk staff was very helpful with recommendations for restaurants and city sights. A special thank you to Goncalo and Vasco . Breakfast was included in our rate. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Porto!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I echo the previous positive reviews of this splendid hotel in a superb position overlooking the city’s main square. We were upgraded to an second floor executive room overlooking the square which at first concerned me but this was groundless as the soundproofing was very good and I slept well every night in the wide, very comfortable bed – no noise could be heard from adjacent rooms and hardly any from street. The bathroom was magnificent with separate WC and wet room in addition to the good size tub. Lovely big towels were replaced every day.
reviews.title: Superb hotel in ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast in the dining room (the Astoria restaurant) and felt guilty watching commuters from Sao Bento station hurrying through the rain as we feasted on the comprehensive buffet. We did not dine there as prices seemed high and there were many tempting restaurants around to try.
reviews.title: Great hotel at great location in the beautiful city of Porto
All as one could expect
reviews.text: All hotel staff were extremely helpful and pleasant, especially at the concierge desk.

We stayed for 3 days in InterContinental Porto Palacio das Cardosas as a couples week-end escape and we only can say superlatives for the hotel. Located In the heart of the city, walking distance from everything you need in the center of Porto.
reviews.title: Exceeded high expectations

reviews.text: not much to be noted, but the breakfast quality has to be improved; true, they made a 50% discount in them considering little fails...but it is for its worth a great choice in O'Porto!
reviews.title: great location in the heart of the city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the best thing though is location, and the MATTRESSES, you feel like in heaven; staff is also very happy and diligent.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, Perfect location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Intercontinental is not very big.Located in a former palace / convent in a protected area classified by Unesco as World Heritge if you look the facade you don´t know if it is an hotel or another beautiful building of this area.. Inside we have a comfortable hotel with all the things that a 5 star hotel has to have. We chose a room with view to the Liberdade Square / Avenida dos Aliados and it had enough space, two balconys to the square and at least at the third floor we didn´t hear any noise. The bed was very good and the bathroom normal for a five star hotel.
reviews.title: Stayed in the Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very good, not with a big quantity but with fresh products that they were replacing without delays. The service in all the hotel reception, doorman, rooms and breakfast excellent without any remark. So I would recomend this hotel to a friend.
reviews.title: Stunning view, perfect staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This classey heritage hotel was a delight. The complete package was wonderfull. It may have been a little pricey but well worth it. The location is perfect, The staff are outstanding and the rooms are clean and perfect to sleep in. Breakfasts are a bit pricy at 22 euros but the setting is worth it. Wi/Fi and buisness computers were available at no charge. The hotel is located at the south end of the main square and several restaurants and attractions are all within easy walking distance. Visit the Porto wineries and listen to some Fada while in Porto. We loved the whole place a week there was not long enough and want to go back.
reviews.title: Long weekend at Porto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The old adage of "location, location, location" certainly applies for the Palacio das Cardosas. Literally around the corner from the central train station in central Porto. Well within walking distance of central city sites.
reviews.title: Excellent Premier Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful starting from the moment you walk into the lobby. The reception staff is efficient and extremely accommodating. The accommodations are what you would expect from a high-end hotel.
reviews.title: A stay you shouldn't miss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only in Porto for three days and leveraged the services of the concierge to maximize our stay.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, delightful stay

reviews.text: Be aware that at this time the buildings surrounding the interior courtyard are being extensively rehabbed. Interior facing rooms should expect some construction noise.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: We recently stayed in this hotel in Porto and we couldn't have found a better hotel. The stay was unplanned as we had reservations elsewhere that didn't work out. We showed up at the hotel 10:00 pm without a reservation and from that moment on we're treated like extended family. The room was high end and very comfortable with an awesome view of the plaza. The staff was amazing - from reception to the concierge's recommendations and love of their city. We opted for breakfast for a good start to the day and didn't disappoint. Great hotel and location in the historic center.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel in the centre of Porto

aka: Intercontinental Porto Palacio Das Cardosas Hotel Porto
description: HISTORICAL PALACE AT THE HEART OF THE CITY CENTRE. Located in the heart of the Historical Centre, classified as World Heritage by UNESCO, the InterContinental Porto - Palacio das Cardosas is the result of a careful renovation of a palace dated from the end of the 18th century. The Hotel is located in Oporto’s main city square, the Praça da Liberdade,within walking distance from all the major cultural highlights,trendy shops, bars and restaurants. The Hotel comprises 105 spacious rooms and suites, the Astoria Restaurant, Cardosas Bar, meeting and banqueting rooms, as well as a Wellness Centre.
